Addendum

Fairing mass should also be contained in the actual parts that separate, not just the base (which is currently the case). Ditching fairings should increase your usable dV because you're carrying less mass.

Addendum 2

Engines should not be prevented from being activated while "stowed." Rocket engines work in a vacuum, so there's no reason they can't work inside a fairing. There is no good reason for this engine behavior, and it causes more bugs than necessary.

Addendum 3

Fairing mass should be reasonable, and not so heavy that they hurt dV more than they help.

Thanks. While I don't necessarily believe we will be forced to have fairings that separate like a too-vigorously-opened bag of chips, I really hope it's not what we get. I would be OK with it being an option though, because hey, why not.

I will admit, I really like the look of those fairings separating into bits. I do however very much hope it will be possible to fix this behaviour. If we hate it enough Squad might decided to make them separate together.

I think the problem here is that the each bit of a fiaring is its own part, unlike Procedural Fairings where each part is a whole part.

Heres the thing for me. When I stage the nuke engine and the 2 bits of outer shell fly away, twirling slowly like the last two leaves from a maple tree in November, It looks awesome, and I feel cool.

But If I pop the fairing off of my new satellite, and It looks like I'm surrounded by dozens of schoolkids failed paper-mache projects, I dont think I will feel so cool.
